content.2: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love
content.3: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name
content.4: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.
content.6: Look not upon me, because I
content.7: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest
content.8: If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.
content.9: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.
content.10: Thy cheeks are comely with rows
content.11: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.
